Except most supports are made to work with low gold. That's why they are supports, because if they needed much gold, they would be in a position where you get consistent gold.
"Work with low gold" doesn't mean they aren't better with gold. Which they are.

Everyone is better with a lot of gold. However, they don't need it in order to be effective, nor are they more effective with it than carry champions (of course, it depends on a champion, but that's the general idea).

That said... It's okay to get a kill as a support if there was a risk involved in leaving the kill to other member of the team (usually it's either you/teammates in danger of dying or enemy having a chance to escape - which, if you think about it, is how most kills are, so don't feel bad about securing them). And of course, there are tons of simply unplanned kill steals and those aren't a big deal either.

However, if you are playing a support champion and purposely try take a decent amount of kills (usually by saving big abilities until they will kill the target instantly - which also can lead to enemy escaping or killing your allies) then you are gimping your own team, by feeding yourself gold that your team needs to be effective (contrary to yourself). Also, if you do this and your carry is Draven then I hate you.

back in the day when supports ended the game with boots, shurelias, and randiuns (when they were feD) this was true. 

But now, supports spike as hard as carries do - the just dont do the damage. Take {{item:3050}} - when i finish this item, its activation gives you more crit than if you just bought the 50% crit yourself.
Critting a on a bf swords is not as great as completing an ie.
and getting 50% crit from your support is better than not getting 50% crit from your support.

I wouldn't say that they spike as hard as carries, even though they do spike more than they used to (ah, the ~~good~~ old times of Boots, Philo Stone and/or Heart of Gold + Wards and nothing else). Especially Zeke augments an already strong carry, usually with an IE. Without IE, the support power spike is much lower (and you would usually prefer to having ADC with IE rather than ADC without one and you with Zeke - of course, optimal option would be to have both).

And on another note - I can bet Zeke will be nerfed (after players will realize how huge amounts of stats it gives).

The adc got all kinds of angry at me, but I walked back into lane with a level advantage and a fiendish codex. I didn't ks those kills, I fired an ability into a moshpit and got lucky. I don't tolerate toxic af carries who think they're gods when they lock in MF or Varus and feed whilst trash talking.  Aint havin none of that.  If it's a Draven doing this to me, I'll show leniency if they quit being toxic and dedicate my AP to helping him get kills rather than to getting them myself and all will be fine.  I am not unreasonable, I just have standards.

First of all, I completely agree that flaming for a kill "steal" (or at all to be honest) is unforgivable.

Second, I did write that it depends on champion type you pick and even made emphasis on "if you are playing a support champion" rather than just support. Champions like Annie or Brand are mages, even if they are played on a support role. Sona can be both. And then there are picks like Leona, Nami or Braum, which are the support champions (as they tend to build support items (generally items that benefit the whole team, rather than only themselves). I mean, sure... You can build Braum as a mage, but it won't be as effective as support build or tank build).

As for the Draven, the important part is taking the kills on **purpose**. If it happens by accident, then it's all right, but if you are playing that Annie that waits with her freaking Tibbers until enemy is on 15% health (sadly, I met a support like that) then you are severely reducing effectivness of your team (as his passive can easily be worth another kill or even two). And of course, even then you shouldn't flame as Draven (mostly because flame serves no purpose at all, not because you don't feel like it).

Yea, sorry if i sounded a bit ticked.  I spent the entirety of season 4 as a support main only with no other skills (my friends brought me onto League to be their support, so that was all I knew) and the biggest annoyance was flaming adcs.  I once played with a Trist as Leona and for some reason, my w going off got every kill.  I was an 11/0/? Leona at 20 minutes and was so tanky I could 1v3, and by that point I couldn't stop my own base damages from being high (I was easily 4-5 levels ahead of her cuz i started roaming to try and give her time to get killls).  Idk what happened that game, but Trist spent the entirety of it calling me a trash fag.  I have never accidentally stolen so many kills in any other instance, but being an 11/0 Leona sup is a feeling I can only describe as the equivalent of fed Mundo with hard cc and a gap closer.  It was so fun after my entire team muted trist.  Likewise though, I get the flaming in that situation.  If I could've stopped my w, I would've, and it must've been incredibly frustrating to be an adc that went 0/0/? (i think it was 7 when I left lane) with a fed Leona that seems to get every kill.  That one is totally understandable (I still kinda want it to happen again though.  I have never enjoyed Leona as much as I did that game).

They are better with gold, but the ADC is much better with gold. When you can choose between the guy who is gonna stand there and tank hits/the guy who's gonna engage and then immediately die, or the guy who's doing 50% of your team's damage, who would you rather have gold go to. Many teams fall into the trap of feeding their tank and then falling off late game because that person will do jack squat in fights other than do a little CC and then hope that the enemy focuses them.

It wasn't a trap in tank meta, and it still isn't with the right teams.  I still find 2-3 tanks per team to be extremely effective versus teams with 1.  Fed tanks get fed teams from fights where the Sion half-healthed you while you were knocked up, slowed, knocked up again, and burned with sunfire cape.  You get past him?  Have fun with Leona.  Got past her?  How about Gragas?  If you made it past him, you deserve a shot at the carries.

That would not happen. That is assuming that 3 tanks all got fed. If 3 tanks got fed, then yes, it's good. But if only one gets fed, then you won't be doing basically any damage in fights. If I fed my lane opponent Sion, then he'll have CC, and he'll tank hits. That is all. We don't even need to look at him until we've killed everyone else.

That heavily depends on who you are.  I usually find that as Sion I can stop most people, with the exception of blink-based assassins like Talon, Zed, and Katarina. LB is a bit tough, but usually I just put myself far enough between my team and theirs that they cant hit my team without dealing with me first and that doesnt go well for them.  Or I just ult in and do devastating amounts of damage with mah ult, but thats a lot less reliable.  I do see your point in that a fed tank is less damage, but they've put in a good deal of work (especially recently) to make sure that tanks still do decent to good damage usually.

Full tanks cannot really do that much damage. Sure, BRUISER items give bruisers more options for damage + tank, but if somebody like Mao'kai wants to build full tanky items, you aren't doing much damage.

One item usually suffices.  For instance, devourer udyr.  Or Darius in general.  Or Cho'gath with a rod of ages.  They wont carry a game, but they'll often do enough to kill squishies pretty easily (except Cho against sustain.
